workflow.heading: Technical Architecture
workflow.intro: Super Shepherd runs as a GitHub Actions workflow, polling for labeled issues every 30 seconds. When detected, it spins up a containerized Claude Code environment with full repo access and Git credentials. The system handles the complete lifecycle from issue to merged PR.

step1.title: 1. Issue Trigger
step1.descriptionEnd: triggers webhook or polling detection. Issue body parsed for requirements, linked issues, and technical context.

step2.title: 2. Environment Provisioning
step2.description: Orchestrator spawns isolated Docker container with Node.js 20, Claude Code CLI, gh CLI, and Git configured with repo credentials. Full clone with history for context.

step3.title: 3. Autonomous Implementation
step3.description: Claude Code analyzes codebase structure, identifies affected files, implements solution, runs tests, and validates changes. Handles multi-file refactors and cross-cutting concerns.

step4.title: 4. PR Creation & Review
step4.description: Changes committed to feature branch, PR opened with detailed description linking to issue, and issue auto-closed. Ready for human code review and CI/CD pipeline.

deployment.docker: Docker container (recommended): Pre-built image with Claude Code CLI and dependencies

q1.question: How does it handle merge conflicts?
q1.answer: Claude Code attempts to resolve conflicts automatically by analyzing both branches. If resolution is uncertain, it creates a draft PR with conflict markers and comments explaining the issue for human review.

q2.question: What happens if Claude Code produces incorrect code?
q2.answer: All changes go through standard PR reviewâ€”nothing merges without approval. Failed test suites are caught pre-PR. You maintain full control over what enters your codebase.

q3.question: Can we run this on-premises?
q3.answer: Yes. Use GitHub Enterprise with self-hosted runners. You'll need to host the orchestrator and provide Claude Code API access. All code stays within your infrastructure.

q4.question: How do you handle secrets and credentials?
q4.answer: GitHub tokens stored as encrypted Actions secrets. API keys never logged. Claude Code runs in ephemeral containers with minimal permissions. Audit trail via Git history.

q5.question: What's the success rate for different issue types?
q5.answer: Bug fixes: 85%, Linting/formatting: 95%, Type additions: 90%, Refactoring: 75%, New features: 60%. Complex architectural changes require human implementation.

q6.question: Can we customize the AI prompts?
q6.answer: Yes. Override default prompts via .github/super-shepherd.yml config. Define task-specific instructions, coding standards, and quality gates per issue label.

q7.question: Does it work with monorepos?
q7.answer: Yes. Claude Code understands monorepo structures (Nx, Turborepo, Lerna). Handles cross-package dependencies and runs affected tests. May require workspace-specific config.

q8.question: How do we integrate with existing CI/CD?
q8.answer: PRs trigger your normal CI pipeline. Super Shepherd respects branch protection rules, required status checks, and approval requirements. Works alongside human developers.
